DataElement.preferredName: Tumor Mass Bladder Neoplasm Histologic Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of tissue in which a malignant neoplasm involving the bladder originated.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells._Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells.

Property.preferredDefinition: Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated.

Concepts.definition: Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2/14/20 jk Upd RD to "Qualified"; CPTAC released AI. 1/2/20 jk Released per CPTAC SME (Linda) for PRAD Baseline CRF. 7/26/19 jk Updated OC term to Tumor Mass; used on multiple CPTAC CRFs.  6/26/19 jk created for CPTAC Baseline CRFs.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Cancer or tumors of the bladder._Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Bladder Non-Invasive Papillary Urothelial Carcinoma, Low Grade

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Bladder Non-Invasive Papillary Urothelial Carcinoma, Low Grade
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bladder non-invasive papillary urothelial carcinoma characterized by minimal cytologic atypia and infrequent mitotic figures (usually limited to the lower half of the tumor). This type of carcinoma recurs frequently, may invade the bladder wall, and has a low risk of progression.

Concepts.longName: Bladder Non-Invasive Papillary Urothelial Carcinoma, Low Grade
Concepts.definition: Bladder non-invasive papillary urothelial carcinoma characterized by minimal cytologic atypia and infrequent mitotic figures (usually limited to the lower half of the tumor). This type of carcinoma recurs frequently, may invade the bladder wall, and has a low risk of progression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A flat urothelial lesion of variable thickness in the bladder, devoid of papillary structures containing cytologically malignant cells. (WHO 2016)

Concepts.definition: A flat urothelial lesion of variable thickness in the bladder, devoid of papillary structures containing cytologically malignant cells. (WHO 2016)

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added concept annotation and removed special characters for MDR data migration. 3.16.20 mc

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Bladder Non-Invasive Papillary Urothelial Carcinoma, High Grade

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Bladder Non-Invasive Papillary Urothelial Carcinoma, High Grade
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bladder non-invasive papillary urothelial carcinoma characterized by marked architectural and cytologic abnormalities and frequent mitotic figures (at all levels of the urothelium).

Concepts.longName: Bladder Non-Invasive Papillary Urothelial Carcinoma, High Grade
Concepts.definition: Bladder non-invasive papillary urothelial carcinoma characterized by marked architectural and cytologic abnormalities and frequent mitotic figures (at all levels of the urothelium).

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Micropapillary Variant

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Micropapillary Variant
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An infiltrating bladder transitional cell carcinoma exhibiting micropapillary growth pattern.

Concepts.definition: An invasive bladder urothelial carcinoma exhibiting micropapillary growth pattern.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm derived from the transitional epithelium of the urinary tract (urinary bladder, ureter, urethra, or renal pelvis).  It is frequently papillary. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma arising from the urothelial lining of the urinary tract (bladder, renal pelvis, ureter, or urethra).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A selected option that indicated an other histologic type.

Concepts.definition: A selected option that indicated an other histologic type.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 02/03/2015.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Cancer or tumors of the bladder.:Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant, primary or metastatic neoplasm of the bladder.

Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
